snippet: In his death, Aaron Swartz has come to symbolize a debate over cases against those who believe in “freeing” information.
abstract: Aaron Swartz, technology wunderkind who committed suicide, is seen by many after his death as hero of free culture movement, which shares belief in using Internet to provide easy, open access to world's knowledge; had been haunted by upcoming trial in which he had been accused by United States government of gaining illegal access to millions of scholarly papers kept by subscription service Jstor.

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood and Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In his death, Aaron Swartz has come to symbolize a debate over cases against those who believe in “freeing” information.

headline.seo: Aaron Swartz, a Data Crusader and Now, a Cause
headline.main: A Data Crusader, a Defendant and Now, a Cause
headline.print_headline: A Data Crusader, a Defendant and Now, a Cause
